final_answer:
The image is satirical because it contrasts two styles of bus illustrations to poke fun at unrealistic expectations. On the left, the silhouette style emphasizes a busy and efficient public bus filled with standing and seated passengers. The text "YES," suggests agreement or affirmation with this depiction.

On the right, a detailed modern bus interior is shown, where the passengers are sitting in spacious, reclining seats, akin to luxury or first-class travel. This is juxtaposed with the cramped practicality of typical public buses, emphasized by the text "BUT." The humor lies in the exaggeration of luxury bus travel compared to the reality of conventional public transportation.
